intro: Bonjeanea syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian bonjeanea, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with simple, alternate leaves that are often lance-shaped. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in the spring. Bonjeanea syriaca is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
